item.title: Overflowing public bin and littering, 5th December
item.description:
This bin has been overflowing it looks horrible and the bin is also full of dog poo so we would like a dog waste bin on Haggerston Road please near 293 Haggerston Road

item.title: The light in question shines directly into daughters bedroom, 5th December
item.description:
This is causing her not to be able to sleep particularly in the spring and summer when blind needs to be left open to increase ventilation
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Maple Leaf Drive, Blackfen, Greater London

item.title: Motorbike and bicicles parked on foot way, 5th December
item.description:
This is an ongoing problem and not the first time reported. Please resolve this problem. Often bike and motorbike are parked on the driveway and path way blocking entrance of veichle into 52 blacksrock road. We kindly ask so many time to pizza yard to sort the problem. Unfortunately with no positive outcome. Often they as well accumulate rubish and discharge mop bucket dirty water on the road in front of pedestrian gate of the resident building.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Blackstock Road, Finsbury Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leave bags dumped, 5th December

item.title: Clearance of leaves in the close, 5th December
item.description:
Resident reporting the road sweeper does not even come into the close anymore, the last time someone came was about July he drove into close & drove out did not even go the kerb to clear the glass & leaves, (a neighbour had to clear the glass). Resident reporting there still is a lot of leaves dry & wet on the kerb & pavement, resident is unsure why the report was closed on the 27/10/2025. Please could someone look into this for resident slipped at the top end today.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clayworth Close, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti - alleyway between Ravenscourt and Silverdale Road, 5th December
item.description:
There are multiple new instances of graffiti, including in the cul-de-sac of Ravenscourt Road (near lamppost 42F6) and on the Rear gate of 5 Arbrook (near lamppost 42F5). These were done between 4pm yesterday and 11am today. Please could these be removed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leesons Hill, St Paul's Cray, Orpington, Greater London

item.title: Piece of pavemet wabbly, 5th December
item.description:
There is a piece of pavement that is very wabbly. People keep step on it and it became more unstable. A lot of people trip on it. The pavement is in from of 33 Eastcheap business building.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30-40, Eastcheap, City of London

item.title: Old fence posts and rubbish, 5th December
item.description:
A new fence has been erected by a resident in Avington grove and although the metal chain link fence I reported has been removed they have left behind broken fence posts and other rubbish which is still going to be dangerous to park users particularly children and dogs. Please remove all the dangerous wood and metal rubbish

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avington Grove, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Upgainst the telegraph pole, 5th December
item.description:
There’s a dumped freezer and other items of dumped rubbish that keeps ending up in the road which is very dangerous vehicles and public.this rubbish has been dumped there for nearly 1 month now it’s ridiculous. Please get it cleared before Christmas. It’s also an eyesore.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Longdown Road, Southend, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Person has been flytipping many times now in our bins and they left details so we know whobthey ste., 5th December
item.description:
The bins containt hazardous wastes such as nappies and medication. Also food waste which has not been segregated properly. Foxes have then opened these bags and pooped all over our driveway. We have cleaned the driveway many times. We now have evidence as o they have left a medication pack with their name and address.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hervey Road, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet
